dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roaring along through the tunnel. Headed for Coney Island. The Warriors sit side by sida. The Pox slumps down in a seat. Weary. . . Pace battered.

dialogues.speaker: THE FOX
dialogues.text: I don't know, it’ Ss got to stop. This ain't the way people live.-

dialogues.speaker: REMBRANDT
dialogues.text: Don't kid yourself. Where were we headed anyway. /- Tonight just speeded things -

dialogues.speaker: THE FOX
dialogues.text: No...there’s got to be some. choice. Something besides getting our ass chased off and getting wasted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks over at Rembrandt. Rev. 6/16/78 106.

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: This shit don't happen every night.

dialogues.speaker: THE FOX
dialogues.text: Yeah, right. . Not many conclave's come :along... The big Cyrus...going to yun the city. Some crap that was...those cats uptown aren't going to let anyone, much less us, take it away from . them...no way... * They'd drop the A-bomb on us first.

dialogues.speaker: . COWBOY
dialogues.text: Naw. Cyrus was right. It's all there. All we got to do is go steal it.

dialogues.speaker: MERCY
dialogues.text: Yeah. We just got to carry on. We ain't big but we’ re somebody.
Oh yeah. Tell me what we count for.

dialogues.speaker: MERCY
dialogues.text: We do our part. They need us down on the bottom so that there's a top. We get even by ripping them off every time we get 2a chance. .

dialogues.speaker: THE FOX
dialogues.text: That ain't much of a choice.

dialogues.speaker: THE FOX
dialogues.text: I*il teil you something. Don't let go of your spray can. It's your passport in case you want to get out. Rembrandt smiles.

dialogues.speaker: REMARANDT
dialogues.text: Ah, I'm just pretty good.

dialogues.speaker: THE FOX
dialogues.text: . Naw. You're great ...You can make a living at it. ;  Rav. 6/16/78 107-108. contd. 311 311

dialogues.speaker: REMBRENDT
dialogues.text: What's your passport.

dialogues.speaker: THE POX
dialogues.text: I‘m working on it. The train begins to slow...

dialogues.speaker: 312- THE DOORS OPEN , 312
dialogues.text: Assorted late-night passengers. Then two young couples returning from a prom step on board. A iot of laughing and chatting... They move down the car and find four open seats. The doors close, the train starts again. 313 ‘TRAIN “313 The Fox's eyes gradually focus on the two couples across from him.

dialogues.speaker: 313A THE COUPLES ACROSS THE AISLE . 313A
dialogues.text: The boys. wearing white dinner jackets. The girls in long summer formals.

dialogues.speaker: TRE FOX
dialogues.text: Looking at them. Mercy senses The Pox stare... Opens her eyes and sees the couple.

dialogues.speaker: THE TWO COUPLES 315
dialogues.text: Whispering, chuckling among themselvas. One of the boys happens to glance at The Fox and Mercy... .  315 316

dialogues.text: 7 one. of ‘the: 2 boys! protectively takes his date's han 328
. Mercy makes an attempt to pull down her skirt. - The Fox. tugs at bis _ Jacket ~ , :
contD  3us Gradually, the two prom couples fall silent. Oo They simply Look at The Fox and Mercy across the aisle.

dialogues.speaker: TEE FOX AND MERCY , .
dialogues.text: ALL at once they are aware of how they must look. Covered with mud, paint, subway tunnel dirt.

dialogues.text: me THE FOX SS Se 318 . His face darkens. - percy Makes an attempt to straighten her hair. Dawn beginning to streak the sky- — THE TRAIN _ 7 a 323A The door opens and the weary Warriors step out. .

dialogues.speaker: 324A
dialogues.text: 3248 Rev. 6/16/73 lio. CONTD. Snowball, Rembrandt, Cowhoy, Mercy and The Fox. Then, just before the doors close... The Fox turns, stoops and grabs the fallen corsage. Mercy looks at him, he shrugs... Hands her the flowers.

dialogues.speaker: MERCY
dialogues.text: What’s this for.

dialogues.speaker: THE FOX
dialogues.text: Some people |like flowers. I hate seeing anything go to waste, | you know... She takes the flowers. ‘MERCY What's your real name. He's got his head down. Can*t quite look her in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: THE FOX
dialogues.text: Francis. Francis Conroy. They call me’ The Fox because of Francis... you know...and becanse I'm smart. Pause.

dialogues.speaker: MERCY
dialogues.text: Prancis Conroy. I like that nane.

dialogues.speaker: THE FOX
dialogues.text: Yeah. We better ga.

dialogues.speaker: THE WARRIORS . ' 324
dialogues.text: Approach the steps at the side of the platform. Just as they are about to Start down, they pause, look out. —-. All of them too tired to show any emotion.

dialogues.speaker: _ REMBRANDT
dialogues.text: We made it.

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: Yeah, lcoks raal great...

dialogues.speaker: COWEY ISLAND
dialogues.text: The tenements, the beach, the litter. THE Fox 3248 Still leoking,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 324B conrD. THE FOX 3245 325 Home Sweet Home. Pause. .

dialogues.speaker: . THE FOX
dialogues.text: Cowboy was right. It’s all there. Ali anybody's got to do is go steal it. — Pause.

dialogues.speaker: THE FOX
dialogues.text: The hard part is trying to figure if it’s even worth Stealing...

dialogues.speaker: MERCY
dialogues.text: I don't think you're going to hang around here much lenger.

dialogues.speaker: THE FOX
dialogues.text: How come you say that. . MERCY . I don't know. Just a feeling.

dialogues.speaker: TRE FOX
dialogues.text: Yeah. Maybe you're right... Maybe I'll just take off. He starts down the steps.

dialogues.speaker: MERCY
dialogues.text: Wait for me...You know I like traveling too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like traveling. Where'd you ever go.

dialogues.speaker: MERCY
dialogues.text: I've never been anywhere. I just know I'd like it. She follows him down the stairwell.

dialogues.speaker: THE WARRIORS
dialogues.text: A view from across the street as they wearily clump down the stairs. - :  326 327 Rev. 7/16/73 LLiA

dialogues.speaker: CADILLAC HEARSE . 326
dialogues.text: Driven by Rogues. Luther is next to Cropsey, behind the wheel. As the Warriors reach the street, he taps Cropsey’s am, Cropsey turns the key, starts the motor...

dialogues.speaker: THE WARRIORS . 327
dialogues.text: Moving groggily along the widewaAlk. Just beyond them the hearse pulls away from the curb. Starts ta creep alongside them.  112. 327A THE Fox , 327A

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 329 330 331 Walking with the rest. Dog-tired. — : His head down, seeing nothing. Then gradually, the sound of the Cadillac's engine begins to penetrate. He lifts his head, glances over ...

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE CADILLAC 328
dialogues.text: Luther sitting beside Cropsey. THE Fox , 329 No change of expression. . , He simply drops his eyes again, leoks straight ahead. A clam bar diner is fifty or sixty feat up the block. Mercy is walking tiredly on one side of him. Rembrandt on the other.

dialogues.speaker: THE FOX
dialogues.text: Duck behind the clam bar. They walk a few steps further. .- .

dialogues.speaker: REMBRANDT
dialogues.text: What are you talking about A few more steps.

dialogues.speaker: THE FOX
dialogues.text: Duck behind the clam bar. Another pause.

dialogues.speaker: . COWBOY
dialogues.text: What the hell for.

dialogues.speaker: THE FOX
dialogues.text: Just do it. bo it. He suddenly cuts into an alley beside the clam bar. Drags Mercy after him. The other Warriors following.

dialogues.speaker: THE STREET 330
dialogues.text: The Cadillac stops sharply ... /

dialogues.speaker: THE WARRIORS . 332
dialogues.text: Pulling up winded in the service alley.  331  CONTD. rev.6/19/73 ° 113. 331 .It runs along behind the hot deg stands. A long pause. They look at one

dialogues.speaker: THE FOX
dialogues.text: . We got one more bop to go..-

dialogues.speaker: REMBRANDT
dialogues.text: What the shit is this. Who are those guys. CoMBoY Let's bag this one. I had enough for tonight ... We don’t even know these dudes ...

dialogues.speaker: THE FOX
dialogues.text: I doz

dialogues.speaker: REMBRANDT
dialogues.text: That’s them.

dialogues.speaker: THE POX
dialogues.text: Yeah. The Rogues.... the ones what wasted Cyrus. Now they're here to waste us.

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: I got an idea- Let's run.

dialogues.speaker: REMBRANDT
dialogues.text: Yeah. Right.

dialogues.speaker: THE FOX
dialogues.text: Yeah. Sounds great... where we going te run to... another.

dialogues.speaker: SNOWBALL
dialogues.text: Let’s get even. it's the £irst time he’s ever Spokan. Tension building

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: Hey, nobody ever thought you had a tongue.

dialogues.speaker: SNOWBALL
dialogues.text: Let's get even for Cyrus... For Cleon, for Varmin, for Cochise, for Ajax... for Swan.

dialogues.speaker: LOV.O/ LY IB
dialogues.text: id.

dialogues.speaker: , REMBRANDT
dialogues.text: We got to.

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: Yeah... Puck the fucking Rogues. . E'm ready to bop. Now all of them ready to fight.

dialogues.speaker: STREET 332
dialogues.text: The hearse is still there. Waiting.

dialogues.speaker: THE FOX . . .
dialogues.text: Draws Mercy to the end. of the building.

dialogues.speaker: THE FOX
dialogues.text: Look, you wait a couple of seconds after we move, then cut the other way up the alley, take your first right and follow it to the beach. There's. some steps down under the Boardwalk, you wait there.

dialogues.speaker: MERCY
dialogues.text: Why can’t I stay with you.

dialogues.speaker: THE FOX
dialogues.text: Just do what I tell you. Okay ... She's almost afraid to meet his eye. ‘MERCY Listen I never had anything like this, I don't want to lose...

dialogues.speaker: THE FOX
dialogues.text: Just do what I tell you. The Warriors hegin moving down the alley. Peer between the buildings toward the street. omIT 334

dialogues.speaker: THE STREET
dialogues.text: The Cadillac is moving again, keeping pace with them.  334 3364 337 334

dialogues.speaker: THE WARRIORS . 446
dialogues.text: Stili moving along the alley, eyes searching right and teft. ae

dialogues.text: Passes a pile of junk furnitvre. Suddenly reaches to the right... Snaps off the leg of a chair.

dialogues.speaker: THE STREET
dialogues.text: The hearse still moving along. The Rogues watching every break hetween the buildings.

dialogues.speaker: THE WARRIORS . 338
dialogues.text: Cowboy breaks the radio aerial from @ car. Snaps it like a buggy-whip ... . The Fox grabs a loose pipe, jerks it off a brick wall. . Snowball hefts his hall-bat...

dialogues.speaker: . . VOICE
dialogues.text: You guys must be looking for trouble. They all leok down the alley.

dialogues.text: Wher ve sea the ocean, we... . Ss figuze we're home. We're" St safe, . 7 . An almost detached quality to his’ voice ... Ha‘s tooking out toward the horizon line cn the sea... LUTHER; This time you got it wrong. SWAN . Cyrus was a big man. He had a big idea,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 348 Still looking at the sea ... : . . 348 Then he turns, faces Luther for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: SWAN
dialogues.text: Why did you do it. Why did you sheot him. Luther grins. Pause. LUTHER . No reason, I just like doing things like that ... I€ that prick over there hadn't seen me you guys would be okay ... But I guess you already thought of that haven't you.

dialogues.speaker: SWAN
dialogues.text: Let's do it. Me and you. Luther continues shiling. . Now has his hand in his pocket. — . . . LUTHER . One on one, Kiss my ass. You're fucking dead. Ail of you ... and you know it.

dialogues.speaker: SWAN
dialogues.text: I don't think so. Luther raises his hand. Slowly. Magnum .357.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't hear too good, You're dead, cocksucker. Swan smjies. The big gun starts to come up. GO level. Swan pivots. . . . Gun blast and FLICK, CHUNK ..,

dialogues.speaker: LUTHER
dialogues.text: Ocobhhmygoddd:!1 "Swan's bowie knife has gone entirely through his forearn. The .357 falis harmlessly at his feet. Swan stéps forward. Jerks the knife out of Luther's arm. Wipes the blood on his Pant leg. The Rogues and Warriors stunned by the sudden violence.  348

dialogues.speaker: CONTD 348
dialogues.text: . Luther falis to his knees in the sand. - Clutches his arm. Begins to cry. SWAN : 3483. Just standing there. Looking at the rest of the Rogues.

dialogues.speaker: THE ROGUES 348B
dialogues.text: Glance at one another. And the crying Luther: They start forward ... a reluctant army but willing to Eight ... THE FOX 348c Wide smile across his whole face ... : TEE FOX . I think you guys got bigger - problems than hopping with . us ... His eyes glance beyond the Rogues. —

dialogues.speaker: NEARBY SAND DUNE 349
dialogues.text: A ring of silent faces. The Gramercy Riffs, One hundred of them. The New Cyrus standing at the fore.

dialogues.speaker: THE WARRIORS . 350,
dialogues.text: All of them smiling except Swan.

dialogues.speaker: BEACH 351
dialogues.text: ‘The Riffs now totally circle the warriors and Rogues. Luther still on his knees. Still crying.

dialogues.speaker: THE NEW CYRUS 351A
dialogues.text: Looks down at Luther. Then at Swan.

dialogues.speaker: SWAN
dialogues.text: You gave us a bad night.  351 352 rev.6/19/78 120. .

dialogues.speaker: THE FOX
dialogues.text: Bad night my ass. it was shit.

dialogues.speaker: THE NEW CYRUS
dialogues.text: You Warriors are good ... real good. He looks at Luther.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rest is ours.

dialogues.speaker: SWAN
dialogues.text: Take it. Turns, looks at the Warriors. Mercy is walking toward them across the sand. The Fox sees her ... : A moment hetween them.

dialogues.speaker: SWAN
dialogues.text: Let's go home. They start across the beach...

dialogues.speaker: THE RIFFS
dialogues.text: Watching them go. Then turn, ‘The Rogues are no longer visible inside the circle...

dialogues.speaker: THE WARRIORS 382
dialogues.text: Rembrandt walking close te Swan. Sears start coming to his face.

dialogues.speaker: REMBRANDT
dialogues.text: We made it. We made it. Tf don't believe it. We made it.

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: Why not. We're the Warriors. A quiet tone in Rembrandt's voice.

dialogues.speaker: REMBRANDT -
dialogues.text: Yeah... We're the Warriors. They're at the ocean's edge. Cowboy and Rembrandt walk to the water. Stand there ankle deep...

dialogues.speaker: 352C
dialogues.text: Standing alone...

dialogues.speaker: THE FOX AND MERCY
dialogues.text: Off by themselves... The Fox locks at Swan... Nods... Takes Mercy and moves off up the beach...

dialogues.speaker: SWAN ,
dialogues.text: Watching them go... He turns again, looks back at the sea... FADE. Rev. 6/16/78
